poem:
"Ode to the Sighing Hills"

The soothsayers of coal-black 
whisper tales of shifting mounds.
In the Rhondda Fawr valley,
lies the jest of Downing Street. 
"They're on the move," echoes 
tongue of an old miner, in silence bespeaks 
tidings of the tricksy tips. 
Their inspection, a farce remembered, 
giggles in the cruel wind - 
performed by marionettes of Westminster
under the muted sky of Wales.
